name: German Advocaat Cake
author: Anonymous
summary: This classic German cake takes a mere 10 minutes to mix up and features a generous amount of advocaat, a brandy-based liqueur. It's an Easter classic in Germany but it tastes great all year long.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Beat together sunflower seed oil, white sugar, and eggs with an electric mixer until well combined
Slowly add advocaat egg liqueur while stirring
Combine flour and baking powder in a bowl and fold flour mixture into the batter with a spatula until well combined
Pour batter into the prepared cake pan
Bake in the preheated oven on the lowest rack of your oven until a tester comes out clean, about 50 minutes
